metadata.dcterms:title: Anesthesiologists Learning to Use Videolaryngoscopes in Children
metadata.dcterms:creator: Robinson, Joan
Lees, Mackenzie
Spady, Don
Seal, Robert
Csanyi-Fritz, Yvonne
metadata.dcterms:description: The primary purpose of this study was to establish the ability of pediatric anesthesiologists to learn to use two video laryngoscopes - the GlideScope system (GS) and the Karl Storz Direct Coupled Interface.
metadata.dcterms:subject: Medicine, Health and Life Sciences
surgical procedures
video laryngoscopes
intubation
anesthesiology
laryngoscopes
lung
pediatrics
tracheal intubation morbidity
metadata.dcterms:isReferencedBy: Lees, M., Seal, R. F., Spady, D., Csanyi-Fritz, Y., Robinson, J. L. (2013), Randomized trial of success of pediatric anesthesiologists learning to use two video laryngoscopes. Pediatric Anesthesia, 23: 435-439., doi, 10.1111/pan.12091, http://onlinelibrary.wiley.com/doi/10.1111/pan.12091/abstract
